this is boring like you got there worlds thats it and a 6th worlds the new onece and add a romot control to the tank plzz and add some new items like add a firework portal gun to and add you can move around to add a flash light plzz and the shrink gun like you can shrink stuff to
My kid plays this for 30 minutes at a time. Anyone in the family can play it and they all love it.
some friend me please im lonely LOL this good

the game is great for people who is looking for thier first game vr but it needs more coler and more commentry and missions like destroy all target and every mission you complete is a virtual coin and with that coin you can unlock different item like besides shrinking ur self you shrink items and the game is more fun with friends so if you dont have friends,good luck :)

It is a good introduction to VR and I got it with my Touch controllers back when I got that. I have no clue if it's paid for though. I definetly would not be happy if I paid anything for this. It has some fun interactions and is good at showing what VR can do. However, it is boring very quick. Like five minutes quick. Anyway, if it's free get it. Otherwise don't.
fun to learn some things for vr but you cant get a thing to control the tank or i havent found it yet and you cant summon the puppet thing.

review_title: great and fun game love it
one_reviews_text: so much things to do
Good as an introduction to VR but does get boring quickly. New people trying out your VR for the first time would enjoy this.

Toybox is a little simulator that you use for first contact but after a while the game get's a little boring and then you will need friends to play around with so i do reccomend install but also have some friends to play with
Does anyone know how to install the game after you purchase it becaose i cant get further than the purchace button
the game is easy to play and fun to do. if you want something relaxing to do this is it.

review_title: Its a toybox - fun and lots of items
one_reviews_text:
Have fun shooting stuff and interacting with random toys however you want.

Great way to introduce people to VR, comfortable and no stakes for them to feel like they messed up. Yes its simple, but well worth the price.

I love this game and its the only one I tried to lean on a counter and almost fell haha, good times.

This is an good game for people just starting with VR, this really helped me when I first started with the rift. After getting the hang of the controls the game can get a little boring and repetitive.

 The game can also be more enjoyable if you have a friend to mess around with. Me and my friends have had lots of fun just messing around in this game.

That does not mean it can't be enjoyable alone, I have had lots of fun experiences in this game alone.

I can higly suggest this game to people just starting with the rift, and people just looking for some fun with friends or alone.
okay
has to be the dumbest game thing on VR
This game won’t even open no matter how many time I uninstall it and reinstall it again. Horrible waste of money

It's an excellent game for your first few times using the oculus, but after a while, you've used all the toys, seen all three areas, even broke all three of the glass orbs that shift you to other dimensions for a brief time. It seems after that, the replayability tanks to almost none at all. If there were more rooms, more toys, and other things to mess around with, even random open sessions so you're not always alone, it would definitely be something to come back to time and time again.

I love this game so much but it would be great if there was more tools and items and you could 
 play with also more toys .Maybe some music in the background as well. But this still is a great game for social interactions with friends.

Not really sure what they were going for here. Seems pretty meh to me. Just some stuff on a table that you get to toss around an stuff. 

It's ok, just not like amazing or anything. Great kids game I suppose, but I feel the kids young enough to enjoy it probably shouldn't be using VR.
i love it

I really like this game, since it shows you what you can do with the controllers. But when you have tried everything out the replay value gets lower, and since none of my friends have an Oculus, I can't get past the "add friends on your wristwatch" tutorial.
It says that I've played it a number of times, but really just look at a white screen  until I pull off the headset and click closed on the crashed message.
Game will not run it just crashes to a whit screen. You would think if it was part of a box set of game when you buy something it would work.
It's a glorified tech demo and a freaking freaky one at that! I could have sworn I had a nightmare about one of the clowns...
This game was actually mind blowing for me when I first had my first impressions. They can definitely add more to it!
Wanted a bit more toys though

Glorified Tech Demo, not very fun, but it was free so you get what you pay for.
Is it worth the money: Well its free so, yes
Is it worth the time to download: No

review_title: Why aren't more games like this?
one_reviews_text: This should be the first thing that launches when you pair your Oculus Touch instead of First Contact. It shows off what the controllers can do and I really like the blocks that you can build with. There's not that much to do though so I wish more games actually allowed you to pick things up rather than showing a controller model instead of hands and just using it as a pointer.

review_title: Free with Oculus Touch promo: really ?
one_reviews_text: It is easy to say that the touch comes with 6 games when you include a simple demo like that. C'mon ! The fireworks could be good but too limited.

The Oculus demo with the little robot is a more interesting experience than this. It's not even something I'd launch of to show VR to new friends. It's just not on par with any free experience you can get. You just have a few tools in front of you and can act with them, period.

Take some fireworks, put them together against a wall and ... On top there's a tank with a remote control!
5 stars = 4 stars with the best graphics 
4 stars = definitely a realy good investment, will spent a lot of time with it
3 stars = works perfectly, would probably even give some money for it
2 stars =good enough to keep it installed and open it from time to time, wouldn't buy it (again)
1 star = wouldn't buy or install it again but did try / didn't work properly

game turned me gay lol + 5 stars
and plus no deep meaning to it -1 star
am spooked by gnomes so -2 stars

review_title: Always nice to hop in for a few minutes!
one_reviews_text: A great Demo for the rift and awesome for showing to friends. Just playing and messing around with objects like slingshots, RC tanks and laserpistols and fireworks.. Physics and stuff are awesome. Playing it on the first day with my rift was impressive!
gud

Nothing to do in it really...

Has a few neat things like remote control toy tanks. Fun way to get familiar with using the controls. Inevitably I end up trying to create a ring of dynamite, see how far I can throw things etc. Gets boring after a while though.
I recommend this for children and rate it 5 stars for them.
It's ok I guess.  Just a bunch of stuff to shoot and throw around.  More weird then anything.
Nice game!!!
This is the only game my kids (6 & 9 y.o.) enjoy. There is no competition, no timer, no fear, just grab and shoot things. And it's free!

This is a good game for someone still getting used to VR. There isn't a whole lot of content, but everything works well in the game.

Will not start without crashing. Maybe it's cool, and a lot of fun. But when everything else runs fine from Oculus store on my system, this gets 1 star for launching a title that doesn't even run on mine, and others systems.

It just won't download for me I have played it before but then one day I tried to open it and it said no so then I tried to download it again and it wont :(  but it is a good game with friends :) and the fact that it is free and comes with the Rift is even better
great game! the kids loved it and i loved the rocket rc truck. would love more content or updates but still great as it is. only negative was kids found using watch a little difficult.

This is a simple sandbox experience and played solo you will spend maybe 10 minutes in it and probably not see much point. But played onlnie with a friend you'll find there's much more enjoyment to be had. It won't be your go-to experience but there is 30 - 60 minutes of fun to be had here.
every time i go to start the game, it crashes.  I cannot start it.
The standard for multiplayer toy rooms. Great for hanging out and messing around. Not the most in-depth, but cool for demos.
just bad, when i got my oculus bundle i was hoping for better free games that work :(

i played it with my friend its alot better than solo!

this game froze up my computer and crashes every time I try to open it.
This is actually the most amazing experence with a friend

Young children might enjoy this.  Especially if they love doing things over and over again.  There's not many VR environments.  There's really not many toys.  There's really not a whole lot to do.  It probably won't be updated.  The Oculus Touch starter demo is more fun.
Doesn't even start. Crash right away.
i dunno whats wrong with it but the game just wont start at all :/
Great to get to know what VR is all about and for kids to learn too!

It's a toy box. It's meant for children. But as an adult, this is good, harmless fun. I will advise it lets you play with fireworks, which could encourage young children to do the same IRL, but aside from that it's just good, innocent fun.
It's pretty much what it says: some toys to play with in a carnival type setting. My family and I played around with it for an afternoon, and we still pop in once in a while to goof around.
Always get a runtime error when trying to get this to run

Its Great to Test out VR, theres not really anything to do except Mess around, its only Fun for a short while

Its only worth downloading if you`re new to Oculus and want to see the types of games what are possible
Dont even start...
Crashes on Start up.
It kept me entertained for 10 minutes, I mostly enjoyed throwing the fresbie. I will not purchased it, however its a freebie that comes with the Rift.

Meh seen worst but most of the items work poorly compared to other VR experiences. Some items were not easy to pick up (the grey guns in particular) and placement of items around you is far from optimal - it is plain bad if you are in front or standing in front of a desk or have a small play area as that will prevent you from grabbing some of the virtual items in the world around you.
SPOILER: If you get this, shoot yourself with the green gun - that make at least one cool thing to do.
Very enjoyable, interactions are good, better for kids.
In this game I enjoyed throwing objects at other objects, this game overall was very awesome and i'd rate it three and a half stars.

To me this game looks and feels more like a tech demo but it is something very different  for my 6 years old son.  he has a lot of fun doing it again and again.  throwing stuff and playing with the virtual watch.  Also, even if the touch controllers work very well, you can see that some objects like the  purple boomerang doesn't interact so well with the controllers.  taking it and throwing it in the air doesn't work all the time.  overall a fun game for kids.
Spend 10 minutes playing around with some physics and shooting stuff and you're done.
Might be interesting for a few minutes, for someone who have never tried vr before. Personaly I just want to find out how to delete it from my library

A must play with friends. Playing solo is fun but gettin in the game in multiplayer is how this game should be played. Could be longer or just include more content. More environments/maps/levels. Level design talent is there but quantity is low on the amount of levels available. Wireframe of objects could be improve.

the game is fun just looks more like its for younger audieinces its basicly has a bunch of toys like  [guns] [bombs]  [a car] and more it is fun to play with a few areas in the watch a great game for people new to oculus
Not really inspiring. The oculus demos are much better.
It's not much but it's great for the kids to have an interactive experience.    Fun for introducing younger people to VR.
Not very impressive. Good for demonstrating really, really basic VR interactivity, but not much else.
Just crashes out straight away

This is an early showcase at best. It's a pretty slim app where you can use some toys to play around with, but in all honesty, the introduction tutorial for the controllers is a lot better, and this app has worse graphics, worse physics and crashed for me during my first run.

There are better apps out there if you want to play around or just show to a friend for the first time.

review_title: A demo of object interaction in VR
one_reviews_text: Not terribly exciting as a game as such, can be interesting as a first approach of interaction with a variety of virtual objects that work in different ways.

review_title: very fun toy for first vr legs
one_reviews_text: Great fun for few minutes top show to a friend.
It takes less than 30 minutes to play with all the toys and sort of be done with the interaction. Might last an hour with a friend.

I've been playing with a lot of VR apps and games recently. I've even tried building my own simple ones. My main focus was understanding what actions, movements, etc... make the user uncomfortable and/or nauseous. This game, somehow, even in its simplest form, makes you really really uncomfortable. It wasn't long before my friends and I had to close it. Not even sure how they achieved it, as the default Oculus library handles camera movement flawlessly.

review_title: The toys are fine, but there's no game
one_reviews_text: See title.  Not a lot of content, and while some of the novelties might have been new at the time, in July 2017 this just feels like playing someone's Asset Pack demo.
It seems like a very weak tech demo.  Yes you can sample the touch controls but there is zero depth.
But a little lacking.
The game will not start for me. I have wite screen only. I dont remember if I have payd for the game. If so then I wil have my money back.

It's actually a lot of fun to play this game, especially with a friend. The novelty wears off quite quickly tho as there isnt much to explore beyond 30-60 minutes. But definately give it a go for that ~hour of fun.

It makes for a great free demo to briefly play together with a remote friend when they first set up their Oculus Touch controllers.  Beyond that, it'll just take up space on your drive.  Judge its merit accordingly.

review_title: the remote controlled tank is fun
one_reviews_text: playing with the remote controlled tank is fun. All the other gadgets are very simple...

It was fun, until I tried everything it had to offer. The number of toys available are limited and do not control easily. The guns are difficult to aim, the boomerangs are tough to throw correctly, the little tanks are hard to manage. I think I spent the most time just punching the ball hanging from a string. If it weren't free, I would say don't bother. But it is free, so give it a go I guess.

As Oculus used this as their first multiplayer touch demo, it has earned its place in VR history. Beyond that, it is severly lacking in features/content beyond a few minutes. The "First Contact" demo is a much better introduction to Touch.

review_title: Fun free demo for Oculus touch
one_reviews_text: Shows some Oculus touch feature in an interesting way.
Unfortunately, it doesn't have much content. The content it has is alright, but an expansion would be nice.

review_title: Quick fun, nice to goof around
one_reviews_text: Easy to try and demo to friends and kids. Even better when you invite someone online : that way your Oculus Avatar is actually seen :-)

This was a tech demo that was used to show people the capabilites of Touch. There's no great amount of things to do, or anything to make you come back to this again and again. But it's not for that. It's for loading up after first contact to get you used to gripping objects with your middle finger. Play it for fifteen minutes and you'll be completely at home with the Touch controllers. I don't imagine I'll ever load it up again for myself, but it definitely served it's purpose quite well!!!
Maybe this is fun with friends? I don't know, but alone it's just a waste of time
It is very basic and wasn't that much fun.  Barely a tech demo.

The first experience with this demo was really fun, but im guessing playing this with a freind is much more fun, but this game shows great potential for the touch controllers, and as this is a free tech demo im guessing that they where aiming to show developers and gamers how the touch controllers can be used to interact with objects in a varity of ways. so this game/demo got me more excited for the future content. for example picking up the controller that looks like the controller your actually holding that controls a a toy tank made me think could be used to controll something that transports yourself, or it could be used to controll a varity of things like a crane or a camera missile or a game inside a game, but for moving your legs the controlles does not feel immersive, but for controlling anything else they work like a charm,
Very fun to play with your friends :D
Fun and free!

I had thought that Toybox was supposed to be one of the more impressive demos for Touch but it kind of feels like it was made in a few hours, if that. You can spend a few minutes in it, but there is nothing there that is even close to as impressive as the Robot game you play automatically when setting up the controllers. It's free so I can't complain too much. I was just expecting a lot more.

I've to admit I enjoyed the oculus tutorial entry (the one with the robot and the 3d printer) a lot more than toybox.

It's too simple with too little content.
Didn't try the social interaction but can hardly see any fun in shooting a rocket back and forth
Considering it free, it's a clever demo of what can be done and what we can expect from games in the future. Great tracking and realistic physics. Thank you, Oculus, for this free app.
Toybox wasn't as fleshed out as I thought it would have been, but that hasn't stopped me from having fun with it. This is a perfect app for introducing younger kids to touch.

A basic sand box. You can throw and shoot things, play with a puppet, and drive a romote tank. 5min of fun, maybe more with a friend. Tho if you dont have any touch game this may be a good place to find out what you like, and demo some of the basic mechanics you will see in other VR titles.
Glad to have the original Touch tech demo available to show friends the power of Touch - best bit: shrinking a friend down and giving them the robot fists to smash things with
This game would be x100 more fun with more people, sadly enough i don't have many vr friends - so a multiplayer lobby would be much better!
Super fun way to introduce you to Touch controls. Add me as a friend?

Fun for 30 minutes...
You seem to need a friend to get rid of the alarm from the clock.

review_title: Way better than Rec Room IMO
one_reviews_text: Fun sandbox for anyone who want to experience VR
Cool concepts and special effects, i feel like they tried to copy VR funhouse on HTC vive except horribly far inferior in every aspect, the graphics feel half baked.
and it`s not bad
Very disapointing experience. Almost no content, 30 seconds of playing around, and poorly done.
how social and entertaining VR can be
